title: Ready to boost your competitiveness with AI?
subtitle: Take this brief assessment to generate your personalized action plan and define your next strategic step in Generative AI.
desc: You are innovating at high speed to transform your business, but how do you ensure competitiveness? Find out now.
bullet1: Detailed maturity score benchmarked against the market.
bullet2: Personalized action plan for your transformation.
formSub: Fill in your details to begin. It takes only 5 minutes.
selectOption: Please select one of the answers below:
rec1Desc: Schedule a technical and business workshop to analyze gaps in dimensions with lower scores.
rec2Desc: Design a Cloud strategy on AWS specifically adapted to your current level ({{level}}).
rec3Desc: Prioritize 1 or 2 Generative AI use cases to build a Proof of Concept (PoC) demonstrating short-term value.

exploring.desc: Your organization is in an initial exploration stage. The immediate focus should be on AI literacy, aligning business leaders, and creating a secure framework for technological experimentation.

adopting.desc: You have taken solid steps toward AI adoption. The goal now is to structure these isolated initiatives through a well-defined proof of concept (PoC), establishing clear KPIs and solid data governance foundations.

implementing.desc: You have a prominent maturity level with running solutions. The strategic priority is to scale these tools, integrate MLOps/LLMOps practices, and expand enablement to multiple enterprise areas.

transforming.desc: You operate as leaders in technological innovation with AI. The focus should remain on continuous optimization, exploring complex Agentic AI, and maximizing enterprise-wide ROI.

questions.title: Generative AI Use Case Identification
questions.text: Does your organization have guidelines to identify and prioritize use cases that could benefit from Generative AI or Agentic AI capabilities?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No guidelines exist.
options.desc: Generative AI use case identification occurs reactively and in an uncoordinated manner, driven by individual interests or ad-hoc requests.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic guidelines exist
options.desc: for Generative AI but are applied inconsistently across teams, without alignment to organizational objectives.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Defined guidelines
options.desc: to identify Generative AI and Agentic AI opportunities with clear roles, business value-based prioritization, and risk assessments.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Guidelines are proactively managed
options.desc: with quantitative measurements. The performance of existing implementations informs new use cases with clear metrics.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Guidelines are continuously evaluated and refined
options.desc: with data and feedback. The organization proactively seeks new use cases and integrates emerging capabilities.

questions.title: Generative AI Integration into Processes
questions.text: Does your organization have mechanisms to integrate Generative AI and Agentic AI solutions into existing business processes?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No integration mechanisms exist.
options.desc: Generative AI solutions are implemented as isolated experiments or proofs of concept without focus on broader integration.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic integration approaches
options.desc: are defined but applied inconsistently. There is no standardized organizational approach to incorporating Generative AI.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Defined guidelines
options.desc: to integrate Generative AI and Agentic AI solutions. Training is developed to address new data, privacy, and risk requirements.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Integration mechanisms are proactively managed
options.desc: with strong coordination. Clear KPIs track process improvements and agent performance.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: The organization actively optimizes integration
options.desc: of Generative AI into processes. The approach is refined through feedback cycles with measurable impact tracking.

questions.title: AI Skills Development Program
questions.text: Is there an AI skills development program focused on different personas (business leaders, AI developers, data engineers, data scientists, end users) covering ML, Generative AI, and Agentic AI?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No structured program exists
options.desc: for AI skills development. Learning occurs individually without distinction between organizational roles.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic training materials
options.desc: are available but applied inconsistently. Informal workshops for technical roles without a structured persona-based focus.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Defined AI learning paths
options.desc: for different personas with regular sessions. Roles are defined in the learning journey with curriculum and evaluation methods.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Comprehensive program
options.desc: for skills development actively managed with tracked progress. Performance metrics are established and regularly reviewed.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Adaptive program that evolves
options.desc: with feedback and emerging technologies. Skill gaps are addressed proactively with measurable business impact.

questions.title: Responsible AI Usage Policies
questions.text: Are Responsible AI policies and guidelines integrated into development processes, operational guidelines, and risk management frameworks?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No formal Responsible AI policies exist.
options.desc: Model documentation is absent or ad-hoc without a standardized approach. Teams make decisions without formal guidance.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic Responsible AI policies
options.desc: exist but are applied inconsistently. Basic documentation templates vary across teams with limited coverage.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Responsible AI guidelines are applied
options.desc: across the organization with documentation requirements. Templates cover development, ethical principles, privacy, and bias.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Responsible AI framework
options.desc: with implementation guidelines, mitigation plans, and risk management processes. Robust model documentation.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Proactive development and refinement
options.desc: of Responsible AI guidelines. Documentation captures the full AI lifecycle integrated with governance systems.

questions.title: AI Risk Assessment
questions.text: Has your organization established mechanisms to pre-assess the potential business, legal, and ethical impact of non-deterministic AI solutions (unexpected outputs, hallucinations, unpredictable Agentic AI behavior) along with mitigation practices?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No formal AI risk assessment processes exist.
options.desc: Responses to unexpected behavior are reactive and occur only after incidents.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic Risk Assessment Framework
options.desc: and Guardrails exist but are applied inconsistently. Limited consideration of risks from Agentic AI.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Standardized Risk Assessment Framework
options.desc: across the organization. Documented guidelines to identify, evaluate, and mitigate potential AI risks.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Framework includes scenario analysis
options.desc: to anticipate potential outcomes and their impact. Mitigation strategies such as Guardrails are implemented.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Comprehensive and proactive strategy
options.desc: for AI risk assessment and mitigation that evolves with emerging capabilities. Best practices are documented and shared.

questions.title: AI-First Design Practices
questions.text: Has your organization adopted AI-First Design practices, ensuring developers understand the unique characteristics of working with ML, Generative AI, and Agentic AI?

options.label: Initial
options.title: AI-First Design practices have not been adopted.
options.desc: Developers lack understanding of AI concepts such as probabilistic outputs or Agentic AI.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic awareness
options.desc: of how AI uncertainty affects user experience. Interfaces occasionally consider AI limitations without a consistent approach.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Applications are designed considering
options.desc: how AI uncertainty affects users. Standard architectural patterns exist to manage uncertainty and Agentic AI.

options.label: Measured
options.title: AI-First Design practices
options.desc: with advanced skills in building robust user experiences. Metrics track user satisfaction across varying confidence levels.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Applications integrate AI components
options.desc: with advanced uncertainty quantification and dynamic adaptation. Metrics demonstrate consistent excellence.

questions.title: AI Lifecycle Platforms
questions.text: Does your organization use AI platforms that support all aspects of the AI lifecycle ‚Äî from data preparation to deployment and production management ‚Äî for ML, Generative AI, and Agentic AI solutions?

options.label: Initial
options.title: Disconnected tools and platforms
options.desc: support isolated aspects of the AI lifecycle. Teams use different tools for various stages.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Platforms support some aspects
options.desc: of the AI lifecycle. Workflows are not integrated end-to-end, with limited support for MLOps or FMOps.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Platforms support most aspects
options.desc: of the AI lifecycle with integrated capabilities. Consistent approaches with basic automation.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Platforms include advanced capabilities
options.desc: for data preparation, development, deployment automation, and management. Efficient integrated workflows.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Platforms optimize workflows
options.desc: across all AI lifecycle stages with advanced monitoring tools. Continuous improvement processes based on usage insights.

questions.title: Environment Security Practices
questions.text: Has your organization implemented best practices to maintain secure environments and data, prevent data leakage, and protect AI systems against vulnerabilities and unintended behaviors?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No defined security practices exist
options.desc: for AI environments or data protection. Security controls for AI models are ad-hoc and reactive.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic security controls are in place
options.desc: but not comprehensive for AI-specific needs. Awareness of data leakage risks is applied inconsistently.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Guidelines exist to evaluate and prevent
options.desc: data leakage risks. Protocols guide the protection of models, data, and Agentic AI behavior.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Comprehensive security controls are monitored
options.desc: actively with quantitative metrics. Automated detection of potential data leakage.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: The organization proactively adapts and improves
options.desc: AI security practices. Measures are continuously optimized based on emerging threats and best practices.

questions.title: AI Security Policies
questions.text: Has your organization established clear AI Security Policies, standards, and guidelines along with defined roles and responsibilities?

options.label: Initial
options.title: No AI Security Policies or standards exist.
options.desc: Security roles and responsibilities for AI systems are undefined or unclear.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic AI Security Policies are documented
options.desc: but applied inconsistently. Initial roles are defined but lack full AI coverage.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Governance framework is established
options.desc: with clear policies, standards, and guidelines. Roles are well defined across all aspects.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Comprehensive Governance framework is actively managed
options.desc: with quantitative metrics. Regular audits assess policy effectiveness.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: AI security governance proactively adapts
options.desc: to emerging challenges. AI Security Policies are continuously updated based on measured outcomes and threats.

questions.title: Observability Mechanisms
questions.text: Has your organization established automated mechanisms for observability and incident response in AI solutions?

options.label: Initial
options.title: Lack of automated monitoring mechanisms.
options.desc: There is no systematic way to detect or respond to incidents, relying primarily on user reports.

options.label: Foundational
options.title: Basic monitoring tools are implemented
options.desc: for some AI solutions with inconsistent coverage. Simple alerts exist for obvious failures.

options.label: Defined
options.title: Standardized monitoring and observability practices are automated.
options.desc: Dashboards track model performance and system health with configured alerts.

options.label: Measured
options.title: Automated observability tools provide deep insights.
options.desc: Automated response mechanisms handle common incidents with rapid escalation.

options.label: Optimized
options.title: Capability to detect, diagnose, and resolve issues
options.desc: before impacting users. Highly automated response with human oversight and predictive analytics.
